answers.answer: Hi.  Your present symptoms seem to be different from that of shingles.  This can be due to blood vessel or vascular problems associated with the specific limb.  The blood supply may be affected especially if a person has systemic diseases such as hypertension or diabetes mellitus.  Nerve compression can also present with these symptoms such as spine problems impinging nerves.  Since there are several possibilities, it is best that you notify your doctor about this and possibly get examined.Regards and God bless.

question: Four days a go I had what felt like severe pins and needles from my left elbow down to my hand.  When I raised by arm and wrigled my fingers i lost control of my arm and hand. My arm felt like it was going to burst and my fingers were uncontrolably wriggling.  When it stopped it felt like pins and needles in my left finger and up my arm.  after a couple of hours the pain became mild leaving me now with a  persistent tingling left arm and little finger.  My arm feels tingling like it is full of air or something....I had singles when i was 25 six years ago.  Is this a flare up or should i consult my GP asap or will this go a way on its own???
title: tingling left arm
